Detailed Description

IMEService provides a standard implementation of an InputMethod, which final implementations can derive from and customize.

This provides a basic framework for standard UI elements (input widget, candidates widget, and running in fullscreen mode), but it is up to a particular implementor to decide how to use them. 

 #include <gaia/service/IMEService.h>
 using namespace gaia::service;

 class CustomizeIME : public IMEService {
     // members and function declarations here

     gaia::core::Result onLoad();
     gaia::core::Result onDismiss();
     void onInitializeInterface();
     gaia::core::Widget* onCreateInputWidget();
     gaia::core::Widget* onCreateCandidatesWidget();
 };

 // override
 gaia::core::Result onLoad() {
     // do something at the beginning of the service
     // return the result flag
 }

 // override
 gaia::core::Result onDismiss() {
     // do something at the end of the service
     // return the result flag
 }

 // override
 void onInitializeInterface() {
     // do something after the service is loaded
 }

 // override
 gaia::core::Widget* onCreateInputWidget() {
     // return the keyboard widget
 }

 // override
 gaia::core::Widget* onCreateCandidatesWidget() {
     // return the candidates widget
 }

virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::onComputeInsets ( gaia::service::IMEInsets  outInsets) [virtual]

Compute the interesting insets into your UI.

The default implementation uses the top of the candidates frame for the visible insets, and the top of the input frame for the content insets. The default touchable insets are equals the visible insets.

Note that this method is not called when isExtractViewShown returns true, since in that case the application is left as-is behind the input method and not impacted by anything in its UI.

Parameters:
[in]outInsetsFill in with the current UI insets.
virtual gaia::core::Widget* gaia::service::IMEService::onCreateCandidatesWidget ( ) [virtual]

Create and return the widget hierarchy used to show candidates.

This will be called once, when the candidate area is first displayed.

Returns:
A widget.
virtual gaia::core::Widget* gaia::service::IMEService::onCreateExtractWidget ( ) [virtual]

Called by the framework to create the layout for showing extacted text.

Only called when in fullscreen mode. The returned view hierarchy must have an ExtractEditText.

virtual gaia::core::Widget* gaia::service::IMEService::onCreateInputWidget ( ) [virtual]

Create and return the widget hierarchy used for the input area (IMEKeyboardWidget).

This will be called once, when the input area is first displayed.

Returns:
IMEKeyboardWidget as a widget.
virtual gaia::core::Result gaia::service::IMEService::onDismiss ( ) [virtual]

This hook represents that the delegate is going to be removed from process.

Try to deal with the aftermath of the whole session. Don't take too long in this hook, or ANR will be triggered.

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Delegate.

virtual bool gaia::service::IMEService::onEvaluateFullscreenMode ( ) [virtual]

Override this to control when the input method should run in fullscreen mode.

The default implementation runs in fullsceen only when the screen is in landscape mode.

virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::onFinishInput ( ) [virtual]

Called to inform the input method that text input has finished in the last editor.

virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::onFinishInputWidget ( bool  finishingInput) [virtual]

Called when the input widget is being hidden from the user.

This will be called either prior to hiding the window, or prior to switching to another target for editing.

The default implementation uses the InputMethodConnection to clear any active composing text; you can override this (not calling the base class implementation) to perform whatever behavior you would like.

Parameters:
[in]finishingInputIf true, onFinishInput() will be called immediately after.
virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::onInitializeInterface ( ) [virtual]

This will be called after the service is first created and after a configuration change happens.

virtual bool gaia::service::IMEService::onKeyDown ( int32_t  keyCode,
const gaia::core::KeyEvent &  event 
) [virtual]

Override this to intercept key down events before they are processed by the application.

Parameters:
[in]keyCodeThe key code of this event.
[in]eventThe key event to be sended.
Returns:
True means IME ignore this key event. Otherwise, the application will not process the event itself.
virtual bool gaia::service::IMEService::onKeyUp ( int32_t  keyCode,
const gaia::core::KeyEvent &  event 
) [virtual]

Parameters:
[in]keyCodeThe key code of this event.
[in]eventThe key event to be sended.
Returns:
True means IME ignore this key event. Otherwise, the application will not process the event itself.

Reimplemented from gaia::core::Delegate.

virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::onStartInput ( const EditorInfo &  info,
bool  restarting 
) [virtual]

Called to inform the input method that text input has started in an editor.

You should use this callback to initialize the state of your input to match the state of the editor give to it.

Parameters:
[in]infoThe EditorInfo of the editor that input is starting in.
[in]restartingTrue if input is restarting in the same editor. Otherwise, indicating this is a new session with editor.
virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::onStartInputWidget ( const EditorInfo &  info,
bool  restarting 
) [virtual]

Called when the input widget is being shown and input has started on a new editor.

Parameters:
[in]infoThe EditorInfo of the editor.
[in]restartingTrue if input is restarting in the same editor. Otherwise, indicating this is a new session with editor.
virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::onUpdateCursor ( const gaia::graphics::Rect &  newCursor) [virtual]

Called when the application has reported a new location of its text cursor.

This is only called if explicitly requested by the input method. The default implementation does nothing

Parameters:
[in]newCursorThe new location of its text cursor.
virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::onUpdateSelection ( int32_t  oldSelStart,
int32_t  oldSelEnd,
int32_t  newSelStart,
int32_t  newSelEnd,
int32_t  candidatesStart,
int32_t  candidatesEnd 
) [virtual]

Called when the application has reported a new selection region of the text.

Parameters:
[in]oldSelStartThe old start position of seleciton.
[in]oldSelEndThe old end position of selection.
[in]newSelStartThe new start position of selection.
[in]newSelEndThe new end position of selection.
[in]candidatesStartThe start position of candidates.
[in]candidatesEndThe end position of candidates.
void gaia::service::IMEService::requestHideSelf ( int32_t  flags)

Close this input method's soft input area, removing it from the display.

Parameters:
[in]flagsProvides additional operating flags. Currently may be 0.
void gaia::service::IMEService::setCandidatesWidgetShown ( bool  shown)

Controls the visibility of the candidates display area.

By default it is hidden.

Parameters:
[in]shownSet true to show, false to hide.
virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::setExtractEditWidget ( ExtractEditWidget *  eeWidget) [virtual]

Replace the extract edit widget.

This must be called to enable the connection between IME and edit widget.

Parameters:
[in]eeWidgetThe extract edit widget which sync with edit widget.
virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::setExtractWidget ( gaia::core::Widget *  widget) [virtual]

Replace the widget in the extracted text area and indicate the extract edit widget.

Parameters:
[in]widgetThe widget in the extracted text area.
virtual void gaia::service::IMEService::setExtractWidgetShown ( bool  shown) [virtual]

Controls the visibility of the extracted text area.

This only applies when the input method is in fullscreen mode, and thus showing extracted text. When false, the extracted text will not be shown, allowing some of the application to be seen behind.

Parameters:
[in]shownSet true to show, false to hide.
void gaia::service::IMEService::setInputWidget ( gaia::core::Widget *  widget)

Replaces the current input widget with a new one.

You only need to call this when dynamically changing the view; normally, you should implement onCreateInputWidget() and create your widget when first needed by the input method.

Parameters:
[in]widgetThe new widget.
